Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: R K
Reviews.Content: Excellent booking facility. Very courteous and helpful staff. Hotel rooms are excellent, large and clean. Good, central location. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Graet hotel for paris standards and prices”
Reviews.Author: Mobydick8
Reviews.Content: Good price value hotel. Had a superior room which was very big for Paris standard

Reviews.Title: “Parisian bliss”
Reviews.Author: fashi0njetsetter
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many different hotels in Paris and this is by far my favourite. I was amazed by the size of the room, as most of the time Parisian hotel rooms are tiny, and it had very modern and chic decor. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. There was a breakfast buffet and an evening 5.30-8.30pm light dinner buffet which was tasty and a great extra. Location was brilliant only a five minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others travelling to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: ZosiaT
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel, since the hotel Rochester was fully booked. Location of the hotel is good - in a relatively quiet street, close to Champs-Elysees. The staff were very nice and helpful, the room and bathroom were very clean. It was also quiet .There was a TV, an electric kettle, tea and coffe and a free mini-bar. What is so advertised on the hotel website is just 2 cans of juice, 2 small bottles of water and coke - refilled every 3 days. However, it is still greatly appreciated, especially if you arrive after long journey. The free evening buffet is mostly breakfast leftovers, 2 extra salads, and some cake. Still it is fresh end excelent if you just want to grab something quick to eat. Comparing to hotel Rochester it was about 50 EUR per night cheaper- and was just a bit less elegant and posh, the choice for breakfast a bit smaller, but you get quite a lot free extras . The atmosphere was also more relaxed. I am going to come back next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures are quite decieving.”
Reviews.Author: pgluv15
Reviews.Content: It is an old hotel that was being renovated at the time of my stay. Think they have changed their name again since I was there. The lifts were very tiny and walking up the stairs may be quicker at times. Lift was so small your lucky to fit two people in there. I asked for two queen size beds but it was more of an single size bed Australian standard. The bathroom was very old with very dated tiles but the water was good. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was the same everyday but could not complain because it's all for convenience. The map of Paris can be quite deceiving. A lot of walking in involved but it's the only way to go to get to know the city. Weather was good but did rain and very chilly and wind on the Eiffel tower. Overall would only recommend if your looking for somewhere to sleep and have something to eat in the morning and your on the go. Be aware Sunday all the shops are pretty much closed.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The location is very close to the Champs-Elysees; easy walking distance. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The champagne on arrival was much appreciated and also the free buffet in the evening was very useful. Some rooms were not nicely renovated. Room was basic. Only 1 set of towels.They had an odd smell and were facing construction site. Free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: meezygo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on weekend of 6th November. Found the staff very friendly and helpful,when we were checking in, girl on desk upgraded us to a bigger room without us asking. Room was comfortable size for two people with view of Eiffal Tower and an outside balcony. Nice touch. Bathroom was ample also. Bed was king size and was one of the most comfortable hotel beds Ive slept in. Appreciated the mini bar also. Breakfast was suffiecient,juice,coffee and croissant,cereal, yogurts,plenty of breads and my better half even managed to put together a fry up! Free Buffet in the evening was provided ,of which we didnt partake because we were eating out all the time but I thought it looked good too. The free glass of champagne was appreciated also. All in all I was satisfied with this hotel, staff were welcoming, very helpful and friendly both on the desk and the housekeeping.I would stay here again hopefully in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, effective and relatively cheap”
Reviews.Author: gwilma
Reviews.Content: It cost 135pounds for two nights, and was in central Paris. As you'd expect, the rooms are functional rather than luxurious. Good if you want somewhere relatively cheap to sleep while you spend time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Three day in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tangoquepasion
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, the room was clean even if not spacious , but there was a wall just front the windows but the positive edge was that there is no noise coming from the external road..! The staff were gentle people and the breakfast included along the free wifi and free minibar has been well appreciated. To appreciate again, the welcome drink with a champagne glass. Regarding the bathroom, I prefer to have two separated mini bottle for shampoo and foam bath instead the one botlle attached to a wall.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Junichiro
Reviews.Content: Enough large room with updated facilities. Breakfast is very good, evening buffet is also value added. Reception desk ladies are helpful. Afordable price for the heart of the city. Internet service is as expected and workable.

Reviews.Title: “Fab walk in booking”
Reviews.Author: StarzTravel
Reviews.Content: We were a walk in booking. The room was cute - very boutique - and clean. It was spacious and smelled good. They provided free breakfast, wifi, and mini bar sodas. The bed was comfortable, as were the down pillows and comforter. Although we just happened upon this hotel, we will seek it out again on our next visit. The bathroom was updated and well lit. It was a great value for the money. We paid 218 Euro for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectations!”
Reviews.Author: HuatulcoBound
Reviews.Content: This feels more like a boutique hotel than a Best Western. The rooms are lovely and spacious -- much larger than most European hotels. All new decor, comfortable beds and good amenities in room. The complimentary breakfast and snacks at 5pm are a very nice touch. Staff are exceptionally polite and helpful -- can't say enough good things about the staff -- from front desk right through to cleaning staff. Location is not the best but it is good - close to l'Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. The only negative was the wireless access, which most often was overloaded and didn't work. There is a free computer with printer in lobby, so that was helpful when it was available. Overall, I was very pleased with the hotel. Coming from North America, one does not expect a lot from a Best Western. This one is an exception to the rule.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended.”
Reviews.Author: culture_matrix
Reviews.Content: Although I am not one to go out of my way to write negative reviews, I felt it necessary to warn others who are considering a stay at this hotel, given that there are many other options in excellent locations around Paris. As a frequent traveler who has experienced my fair share of hotel stays, for both business and pleasure, I can say that, in many respects, this hotel just wasn't up to snuff. For starters, I was in Paris for a conference and, thus, required certain resources to work during my stay in the city. Though the hotel claims to offer "free wireless internet connection" in the rooms, this was not the case. Yes, it is free. What they failed to mention is that it doesn't actually connect you to the Internet; at least, not in a reliable way. Connectivity, for the entire duration of my stay, was limited, at best, and non-existent, at worst. Even the communal computer in the hotel lobby had a sporadic connection. After asking (every day for the full five days of my stay) for them to resolve this issue, by the time I checked out this morning, my concern still hadn't been addressed and no one really seemed to care. Don't advertise it if you don't really offer it. What is more, although my room (# 205) was well maintained and modern, the lack of a full-length mirror (with only a small mirror in the washroom) really put me off. It would have been nice to see what I looked like before attending my meetings but, alas, no such luck. There are no electrical outlets in the washroom, which meant that (without a mirror in the room itself) I resorted to blow drying my hair in front of the webcam on my laptop. Desperate times call for desperate measures... I might also add that the air conditioning in my room was questionable and the "satellite television" was only about ten channels, of which almost all were in French, with the exception of the BBC News. Not really my definition of satellite, but perhaps it is for some. It should also be noted that, while the hotel claims to be environmentally "friendly" and "conservational", I came back, at the end of each day, to a fully made-up room, only to find that all the lights (washroom included) had been left on. As far as I'm concerned, there is a contradiction between the hotel's environmental "standards", which are clearly displayed on lobby's television screen, and the reality that there is nothing "conservational" about leaving lights on all day. That being said, the facilities are (relatively) modern, the continental breakfast is nice, and the location is centrally located next to l'Arc de Triomphe and Les Champs Elysees. Still, I cannot -- and would not -- recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: J4ckL33
Reviews.Content: The rooms are available in two design types (modern and traditional) that have all been renovated recently. We had a beautiful room of the modern type. For Paris the size of the room was absolutely OK.The service was friendly and the breakfast was great. The location of the hotel is very central and close to the bus stop from the airport (place de l'étoile).

Reviews.Title: “Great price value relation”
Reviews.Author: angelampp
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 days in Paris with 2 other couples in it's a perfect place to stay either if you go for business or pleasure. Well located (5min walk to Champs Elysees), clean and remodeled rooms, it would be great if they had a new elevator, but for the rest I recommend it. It has free internet, free breakfast (fair number of choices), tea time with beverages and food from 5:30 to 8pm good for a light supper or get ready for the night activities. The staff spoke english and some spanish, always helpful and corteous, they are missing personnel in the breakfast area but you can handle it perfectly. In our case, we had a very spacious room with nothing to complain. It is not very well sound isolated, but we were so tired that had no problem falling asleep because it had a great bed and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location, and Room!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum7078886
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised when we entered this hotel. It was quite luxurious and a great value. Breakfast was standard fare, but adequate. Parking was quite expensive (about $40USD per day), but luckily we arrived on a weekend. Street parking is free on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Blair H
Reviews.Content: I think the operative words here are location, value for the money and great staff. For me location was the most important element. I wanted to be a short walking distance from the night clubs, the sites and the Champs Elysees. My next criteria was the value for my money. The hotel was well appointed, but not luxurious. I vacationed in Paris 20 years ago so I was prepared for the small elevators (max three people) and rooms, but pleasantly surprised with the space in my room. I've stayed is very small hotel rooms in Europe before (Copenhagen), and this room was more than adequate. My room was on the 4th floor overlookung a small portion of the street and facing other hotels rooms. However, in Paris in the summer the action is in the streets. You want to be outside mingling with people. In Paris if you get a room with a view that is a plus, but if not that does not subtract from the value of the hotel. The lighting in the main sleeping room was a little dark for my taste. I read some people made negative comments about the breakfast and the high tea snack. First, the breakfast was eggs, bacon, sausage, 4 types of cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit and fruit salads, coffee, tea, several types of fresh bread, 3 types of fruit juice and cheeses. If you need more for a standard hotel breakfast then you have a serious problem. Yes; it was the same every day, but so is my breakfast at home (oatmeal). Eating in Paris can be expensive unless you know to get off the main streets and eat at the small mom and pop type places on the side streets. You can get a good inexpensive meal at a little hole in the wall with bench seating. And save your cash for the big meal at a top restaurant and people watching on the Champs Elysees. The high tea snack is perfect to knock off your hunger from a day of siteseeing. There were fruit juices, sliced meats, prepared meats, rice and potato salads (very tasty), breads, coffee, tea, and cakes. It was on from 5:30 pm until 8:30 pm, and for several nights this was dinner for me. Yes; it was the same every night. But, I had extra money to spend on the other pleasures of Paris. And now to the staff! In my opinion the staff is the something extra that will bring me back when (not if) I visit Paris again. The staff was warm and attentive. All of the front office staff and waiters spoke excellent English. I was greeted each time I came into the hotel. The staff at breakfast would quickly fill the requests for items that were running low. On the night I was leaving (a 4:30 am wake up) the guests in the next room decided to have a late night party. I called the front desk at 1 am to get them to quiet down. They did , and I got a little sleep. When I came to the lobby at 6:10 am to wait for my pick up, it was too early for breakfast (7 am). The staff at the front desk left his post and had the breakfast staff prepare a full meal for me. That's what I call service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mommy_of_Boo
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Paris and this was a great place to be based out of. The breakfast was an excellent way to start the day. There were a lot of choices, they did not really change each day, but you can choose to eat healthy, light, or have a bigger breakfast. Good coffee!! Our room (Chambre Superior) was great - as largeras you would expect to find in North America and the bathroom had a tub & shower and a great deal of space. The room was clean, and vert quiet (we were on the courtyard side). The air conditioning worked great - which was great particularly after a day of sightseeing in August. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk tot eh Charles de Gaulle/Etoile metro station which is a great based to access the metro from. The hotel is about 5 minutes from the Arc de Triomphe and about a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel tower - which was awesome. The only downside is that there are a ton of eating options in the area, but with the breakfast - you had a great start to explore and find culinary adventures elsewhere! The staff were very helpful, but there were times where they were so busy you had to wait to get help. But this was a minor inconvenience. We would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: SabrinaSequin
Reviews.Content: Really nice modern hotel. We were travelling with two teenage boys so requested two rooms. Both rooms were next to each other, one was bigger than the other but both good sized. They hadn't read the emails I had sent as the beds in the boys room were not separated (twinned) and made up however, they were changed very quickly after request. Mini bar was not stocked on arrival, it took three requests to rectify. Champagne and afternoon tea very welcome - cake, pate, rolls, cheese, ham, plentiful juice and coffee. Easy reach of Arc de Triumph. Parking difficult, we ended up parking independently going around the roads until we found a car park. Hotel car park for only small cars only.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: pedros2020
Reviews.Content: Very excited going to this 4 star hotel right next to the Arc de Triomphe, especially having lived in Paris before, this was my first time staying in a hotel. However, it is not worth the price. Rooms are small, no bath in bathroom (although some rooms do have a bath), no ironing board in room, air con didn't work and staff were inefficient (they twice told me my air con was working, even though it obviously wasn't). Only tiny mirror, which was annoying when getting ready to go to work (as this was a business trip). TV channel choice was rubbish. Internet was free but never worked during 3 days I was there. Having said all that - location is wonderful. Room was clean. The buffet was nice and the soft drinks from the room's mini bar were free. But for the same price - you can find much better in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Large Parisian hotel rooms in handy location”
Reviews.Author: Ken026
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the final stage of the Tour de France. The hotel is about 5-10 minutes easy walk from the Arc de Triomphe end of the Champs Elysees or from lower down near the Louis Vuitton shop. Both have metro stations on the same line that runs down to the Louvre, Notre Dame etc, metro line 1. If you fly into Charles De Gaulle airport, its one change on the RER train from there at the same station, to the metro at Chatalet Halles. The hotel is about 15 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower past the designer clothing shops on Av George V. The hotel is on a quiet side road and has very few ammenities but does have good sized rooms especially for Paris. We had a premium room that had lots of space to walk around, large wardrobes and a good sized bathroom with seperate walk in shower and nice sized bath. The decor was ok and the room was tidy and clean. The buffet breakfast is served in a small dining room and is the usual continental offering with bacon and scrambled eggs and sausages also on offer. From around 5.30pm until 8pm there is afternoon tea with cold meats, breads, rice and spicy mushroom son offer plus a small range of cakes. Nothing fancy but something to carry you over or enough to eat should you not fancy diner in Paris. The hotel doesnt have a restaurant. I paid 524 euros for 3 nights at what was fairly peak time due to the Tour ending and it being general holiday time. All of the hotel staff were helpful during our stay and we had no problems. The hotel stored our luggage at the start and end of our trip which was a big help. Our room was on the 4th floor at the back of the hotel and had a view of other hotels. If you are on the top floor and are at the front, you may get a better view. Overall. I'd recommend the hotel as offering large rooms for Paris and being in a good easy location in a quiet spot.

Reviews.Title: “No service...”
Reviews.Author: ChiliNuuk
Reviews.Content: I travel as a personal assistant/ personal secretary to a parliament member of my government here in my country, and we're fairly humble as long as some things are ok. For instance a 4 star hotel SHOULD carry a possibility for ironing your shirts in your room, the Etoile Saint Honore did NOT provide this service. Upon arrival, even though I'd already sent them a, confirmed by the way, email that we'd arrive earlier than 2 o clock in the afternoon (which is checkin time), and they'd agreed to have us checkin early (we'd been flying for hours on end) they failed to check us in, couldn't advise a spa/any form of entertainment, or even a place to get a meal while we waited. So we were stuck in their lobby which is BORING for 2,5 hours... Then when we wanted roomservice there wasn't any, there was no restaurant in the hotel, there were no help getting taxis and so on and so forth. All in all a very, very bad hotel. The only up was that the room was beautifully painted although pretty small. Do not choose Etoile Saint Honoree, you can do so much better in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: dadrocks
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Great location for getting on the metro or to the Champs Élysées quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you don`t mind walking to take metro”
Reviews.Author: Titibert-Mexico
Reviews.Content: The hotel is totally remodeled and looks modern. Rooms are small, normal in european hotels but very nice. Downside, nearest metro is about 6 blocks away at Arc de Triomphe, or half a block to a main avenue where you can take a taxi, if you find one. Smallest elevators I have ever seen. Decent european breakfast, scrambled eggs, breads, cheese and ham, yogurt and whole fruits. Wouldn´t return though because it isn´t the best location.

Reviews.Title: “So-so three-star in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: samothrace
Reviews.Content: Pros: So close to Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Elysees; good value for the this upscale neighborhood considering all the "complimentaries" (free soft drinks in mini bar a nice touch). Rooms are clean and those on street have gloriously huge windows, bathrooms spotless. Reception personally always very friendly; hotel offers adjoining rooms, a plus for us. Cons: This is a solid 3-star tarted up to get a 4th one it does not merit. The continental breakfast was awful considering the stale, big-box store mini pastries served (shame!). For this reason, we never tried the afternoon tea or free champagne; rooms dated and spare (ok for a 3-star) but please replace old carpeting; no mirror in the room, and the bathroom (why don't French showers have curtains?) only had one at eye level; convenient adjoining room for our kids was "mignonne" (cute) as they said, but 2/3 smaller than ours for the same price. Also -- no iron despite advertising one. Reception informed us it was a fire hazard, which didn't make us feel very safe. Other complaint was that the car service from airport we booked with the hotel to pick us up never showed. We called the hotel (twice) and they advised we keep waiting. An hour and 15 minutes later, we called a third time, and the hotel reception told us "this never happens", and to wait another 15, that they'd called a cab driver to meet us at the terminal in 5 minutes. Second driver never showed. When we finally arrived at hotel, nobody at reception made mention of our travails. When we checked out of the hotel to move on to our next set of accommodations in Paris, and as I was discussing with my husband how best to get ourselves and our luggage transported, the helpful reception clerk overheard us and said, "Oh, the hotel has a car service! Shall I arrange it for you?" For families on a strict budget, this would nevertheless be okay. But just get there on your own, and stop into one of the excellent nearby patisseries for your breakfast pastry to avoid the tragic specimens at the continental buffet downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, excellent service, facility is older but updated”
Reviews.Author: SeeSawSay
Reviews.Content: This is a gerat location with lots within walking distance. The nearby Metro is a great feature close by. The daily breakfast is ok, but not what one would expect given the hotel prices. Of course Paris is expensive... and this is a good choice for value and location. For pampering and 5 star features, go elsewhere, the staff is very helpful and international guests are attracted by the service . The rooms themselves are a bit outdated, are smallish and not really designed for comfort above and beyond the average. It is a base for exploring in a very convenient neighborhood of an extremely expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “More than OK...”
Reviews.Author: Bobs-big-vacation
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel in a city of high prices. Safe environment. The room was small and basic. However, it had been renovated and was spotlessly clean. English channel TV was available (world Service); free soft drinks in fridge; and free wi-fi (when it worked). The view was of the police station to the side so nothing to speak of. It's a 10 minute walk to the George V metro on the Champs Elysees. Staff were welcoming and helpful. Buffet breakfast offered decent fare and good choice...BUT...the breakfast room is uncomfortably warm and could do with the elevated windows being opened. Looks like they're never opened. Facilities (e.g lobby toilets) were somewhat limited while renovation continues below ground. We were split as to whether it was 'just ok' or better than that and settled for 'more than ok!'

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bagpuss3008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding anniversary and could not have imagined a better place to spend it! Such a lovely hotel and the people are so nice. Breakfast was really nice and the buffet at night was a nice suprise. Definate for anyone wanting a quiet retreat in Paris. Really close to everything and would strongly recommend it to anyone! Beds are really comfy, the only thing I would say is that they could do with investing in anti-slam doors as they can be a bit annoying! not bad if you're out all day though

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ezbracha
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 four nights at Best Western Etoile St. Honore. I had a medical convention during those four days. In one word the stay was great. I arrived at close to midnight very tired after a hard flight. The receptionist was very polite, and very informative about the stay. He told me all about the meals, the tea time boufet that i deserve in spite of bed and breakfast deal i ordered. The minibar was offered free of charge (soft drinks only). each floor has its own wife internet connection free of charge. Add to that he gave me ticket to get one glass of champagne during my stay. The room is a bit small but all i need is a bed to sleep on and hot water for shower. The rest of my stay was very enjoyable. I needed help to get electric adapters for my computer. The receptionist did everything she could to help me finding a store to buy what i need, she printed me map of optional place to buy. In fact i got help for every direction request i needed with maps and a lot of smile. I won't forget my stay in Paris and a big part of that is because this hotel's staff. Thank you for the enjoyable stay, I'll certainly will come back to this hotel when i come - alone or with my wife

Reviews.Title: “I am disable, travel with my wheelchair, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MARCELE
Reviews.Content: I am disable and travel with my wheelchair. The room was big enough for us and the wheelchair. Comfortable with everything one needs. Breakfast very good, I was surprise a little as they start clearing breakfast before the time. There is a young lady call Zurica, she works in the breakfast room. She is very polite,very helpful, very quick,.She sees whatever is missing on a table, or somewhere else in a flash. The reception is very helpful, as well as. Domique and Denis. The porters multitask, and the Tea- Time is welcome, while waiting for diner. The fridge with free bottle water, and soft drink and excellent convenience. Will go back again

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Mattei
Reviews.Content: The attendance is very helpfull, and we enjoyed specially the afternoon break, with soup, breads and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nicely re-decorated, quiet neighbourhood, boring breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: KariBergen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to l'Arc de Triomphe, where two metro lines cross, so good when you need to travel around Paris. Quiet neighbourhood, and I enjoyed the way they had re-decorated the place very much with darkish colours and a very nicely done bathroom. Good size room as well. Receptionists were very helpful. A couple of downsides; the breakfast room, which was very dull, even though the most important, the breakfast options, were OK. also, when my two girlfriends in the second room tried to get a second duvet when separate beds were not possible, it was not sorted out until the next day since the night guard could not get hold of a duvet.

Reviews.Title: “very bad choice”
Reviews.Author: marin123
Reviews.Content: not the comfort expected for a 4 star hotel and a 200 euros per night room. bad services, internet practically not functional (don't go if you need internet), average room, poor restauration, smiling yet inefficient personnel. problems not solved during stay. not to come back, at least not on your own money

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely use this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: AHarper200_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Very clean and comfortable. Slight problem with shower which needed adjustment to avoid water escaping from bath/shower screen. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Afternoon buffet much appreciated. Would recommend and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ossimum
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spotless, the breakfast more than adequate, and the "afternoon high tea" which was free, was a bonus, as were the soft drinks provided free of charge in the mini bar and the complimentary glass of champagne! This Hotel is extremely good value and the english speaking reception staff are very helpful. Although you can get a cold drink by asking at reception, however I would not say that the bar is adequate, and also the hotel would benefit greatly from a restaurant, after a tiring day trekking around Paris.(Although they did have a comprehensive room service menu, but not everyone wants to eat in their bedroom). Otherwise, I would recommend this hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: Luiz_Sobrinho
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just perfect for a few good day in Paris. A couple minutes walking from George V subway station, which is the closest one to Arc de Triomphe, so... you'll be a 5minute walking distance from a postcard. Not enough? Free WiFi, large room and bathroom, good staff, 02 meals included, 02 welcome drink and a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Dida26
Reviews.Content: Had 24 hours in Paris in between flights. Took les cars d'air france which dropped me off at place de l'etoile. Took a taxi for 6 euros to the hotel. then realized i could have walked it, it's just minutes away. The hotel was very pleasant. Friendly and helpful staff. Recently renovated, very modern, very clean (although they were still renovating the bar and reception but that didn't bother me) They offered complementary tea time, champagne glass and buffet breakfast. Did I mention free non-alcoholic drinks from the minibar? Great location, yet quiet neighborhood. Free wifi accessible on every floor. I couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good value and location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: texmln
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel as the booking was made by a colleague. Reasonably priced and fairly close to the heart of Paris this hotel has larger than average rooms that are quite comfortable and modern. Though the lobby was being remodeled it didn't bother my stay and the staff was friendly and helpful - well except for the one girl who stood by watching but couldn't be bothered to assist with check out. But then I wouldn't be in France, if it were any other way, would I?

Reviews.Title: “Good for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Lunarboogie
Reviews.Content: This place is a typically solid Best Western, 3.5-star hotel. The rooms are clean and comfy and every thing else is of the standrad you'd expect. It was a bit soul-less for people who are travelling to Paris for leisure but would be fine for those on business. We were upgraded to a premium room which was plenty roomy for the two of us. The free mini-bar and wifi were nice touches, although the free afternoon tea buffet was a tad off key. It had the ambient charm of a Soviet gulag. The breakfast was nice and simple and hit the spot. There is some construction going on in the foyer and again immediately behind hotel which can be distracting during the day but other than, it was fairly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “very good location, comfortable, clean, welcoming and brightly decorated.”
Reviews.Author: MMPaterson
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, about 10 minutes walk from the Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were nicely decorated. There was a good selection of food for breakfast and afternoon tea was a really nice idea.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Genghis17
Reviews.Content: Perfect location from the bus arriving from CDG and to walk to Lido Theater and Champs des Elysees Buffet breakfast extending to buffet till early dinner is added bonus for free Helpful staff and pleasant rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great front desk”
Reviews.Author: tmhAshevilleNC
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter I we were in Paris for the Marathon and this hotel is ideally placed. Very close to the Champs Elysee, 5 minutes to the Metro and good restaurants within easy walk. The rooms were on the small side but very comfortable beds, good linens and very quiet at night. Front desk Dominic was multi-lingual and very helpful;. The inclusive hot and cold breakfast buffet was good and the afternoon tea was a welcome touch. Would highly recommend this hotel for leisure travel, Marathon de Paris and women travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Paris - City of De-lights”
Reviews.Author: Reiki22
Reviews.Content: My husband and my mother-in-law spent 10 days in Paris and had an amazing holiday. Our hotel suite had a connected bedroom and offered all inclusive amenities (ie: internet, breakfast and a small afternoon buffet). One person had limited mobility which they were able to accommodate with the elevator and ramps. The doorman, Denis was an incredible help for directions and has a wealth of knowledge about Paris in three languages.. At the front desk, Dominique who speaks 5 languages was so friendly and able to answer all our questions and beyond. We were a 5 minutes walk from Les Champs Elysees/Arc de Triomphe and near all restaurants, stores and subway. The only issue was that the scrambled eggs were cold every morning. The rest of the breakfast had variety and was good. Overall, we definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Service made for Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: xxalinkaxx
Reviews.Content: All reviewers mention the size of Paris rooms, they are usually smaller than you would expect. This one was just right but still on the smaller side. The great thing was having a fridge with a couple of waters and colas included. The shower was very small but unique and the bathroom fixtures were new. The only thing to watch out for was the Wi-Fi which was very spotty. They have a router on each floor but my floor [4th] did not work the first night much to my surprise meanwhile my co-workers on the 5th and 6th were streaming videos off of YouTube. The conceirage was extrememly helpful and polite in both offering recommendations, directions and also restarting the router which increase my wi-fi speeds. The location is just a 4-5 minute walk from Champs Elysee boardwalk which is perfect. Great, clean location.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Cosy and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Su76KualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated, the deco is chic and cosy. Breakfast was excellent and the hotel also had supper for its guests. Free internet at the reception. Staff was friendly, helpful and spoke excellent English. Location - around 15 mins walk to the Charles de Gaulle station but not an issue as taxis were available everywhere. Overall, had an enjoyable trip and wouldn't mind coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodel”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegAndrea
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early Saturday morning. Checking in was a strange process, the women at the front desk seemed very overwhelmed with the paperwork of it, but was pleasant nonetheless. We were leaving early again the next morning so we were allowed to have our complimentary breakfast while we waited for rooms to be ready for us. A nice simple breakfast with pastries, fresh fruit, cereal, cheese and cold cuts. We then got rooms early which was a treat after flying overnight. As usual, elevators are tiny and slow, but at least they were there to get luggage up and down. My room was small but very nicely done. Felt like a teenage bedroom with a Parisian feel! Dark purple carpet, black and white furnishings, crystal wall sconces. Bathroom was a good size, clean and white. Our destination was shopping at Gallerie La Faiyette, so the hotel was not as close as we had expected. Needed to cab there, but was just a short was from Champs de Lise.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - nice rooms - very good location!”
Reviews.Author: Tashaken
Reviews.Content: this hotel is good : nice rooms with fridge, coffee and teamaker, nice bathroom with! bath...we did have a "redone or renovated " room at back = very quiet very friendly reception too. This hotel is suitable to visit Paris as you are very close to Arc de Triomphe and Champs elysees. To make the tour through Paris we took the RED BUS - you could get off at each stop, and hop back on next RED Bus that came along like ten mins later. One tip for travelers to ANY best western hotel : make your booking through Their OWN website...saves you up to 50-100 euro!!!

Reviews.Title: “Jolly good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John50ish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 50th Birthday treat & had no complaints at all about this Hotel. The staff were very helpful & nothing was too much trouble. Good breakfast included in the price which kept us going untill our evening meal (apart from several coffees & gateaus from local cafes!) Our room was on the 3rd floor of a good size with a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower.The room even had a free mini bar of soft drinks.The Hotel was well situated close to the Arc de Triomphe(5 min walk) Overall we had an excellent stay at this good quality Hotel & we would certainly come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Marseille
Reviews.Content: Nice room with a great bed and new bathroom. Bad television connection 'snow' on all non french chains. Great breakfeast! Only snag was the ridiculous situation of being forced to wait in line of 5 people (one cashier) when cheeking out in order to settle the €1,58 lodging tax - despite the fact that the room was prepaid.. so you leave what was other wise a great stay with this irritation as you last impression. Silly.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable quality center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: hassfam
Reviews.Content: Good value for money with a quiet position close to Etoile.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location for a sight-seeing Holiday”
Reviews.Author: mrsrgj
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel could not have been nicer - the welcome drink was a nice touch and the hotel was clean and well maintained. If I was to make a complaint then it would be that the lift was very noisy from early in the morning but that really was not worth complaining about. The location was great - 5 minutes walk to the Arc de Triumph, near the Metro and superb restaurants nearby too. You MUST try the Frnech Onion soup in La Lorraine!

Reviews.Title: “great value..”
Reviews.Author: bienscotty
Reviews.Content: i think was a very nice stay ....everything was perfect...if i come back to paris i will definetily stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gabriela055
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel every time I travel to Paris. The hotel has an excellent location (5 minutes walking distance to the Champs Elysees). The reception staff is always very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very large and comfortable and have been newly renovated. I enjoy the late afternoon snack. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Weird! Noisy, uncomfortable but great breakfast and service!”
Reviews.Author: Mackey81
Reviews.Content: Great location, great breakfast and great service. Bed was very uncomfortable, street outside was noisy but only because the windows were quite flimsy. Very noisy room though, you could hear everything from the rooms beside and above. If this was a UK hotel it wouldnt make a 3 star but apparantley in paris this is quite a good standard.

Reviews.Title: “Just Brilliant - dont hesitate book it”
Reviews.Author: AJtripper
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the BW Etoile St Honore after a ski trip to Les Gets. Not dissapointed , Very friendly helpful staff, Great location, wlaking distance to lovely bars bistros etc and the sights 10 mins walk from Arc de T and about 15 mins from Eiffel Tower. Rooms Paris sized but comfortable clean and adequate. Nice Cont breakfasts, nice bar, free welcome glass of fizz, free soft drinks in mini bar Concierge guy VERY HELPFUL and friendly Not sure of value - Hubby paid on My points via Nat west . Dont hesitate to book- I am a Fussy traveller (and stayed in many a dive)and thought it was just GREAT - No Frills and not the four seasons, but just great and leaves you more money for the shops bars etc.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice!”
Reviews.Author: kaka22024
Reviews.Content: Nice people, nice hotel, best quality/price for all the hotels in the area... My preferite choice!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: zhouping
Reviews.Content: Just one thing I can say : This is the best hotel ever !! Great stuff, very good location, renovated room, mini-bar and tea time free... Bravo !

Reviews.Title: “Good value for this location”
Reviews.Author: oxforduser
Reviews.Content: This is prime visitor location: close to the Champs Elysees and walking distance to the main sites of Paris. Most other hotels in the area are far more luxurious with prices to match. The hotel offers few facilities - but then again you may not want any - and appears to be undergoing renovation to bedrooms. Rooms themselves and bathrooms are fine but very small. Breakfast is reasonable, but not extensive, buffet. Staff are friendly and happy to provide recommendations on sights and eating out. Note that many of the rooms give on to the Faubourg St Honore, offering quintessentially Parisian views but with traffic noise to match (although rooms are airconditioned so windows can be kept closed at night). All in all good value if you just want somewhere to sleep in a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “It was amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Beltavares
Reviews.Content: The room (suite jr.) is huge, clear and "clean". The disposition of the parts of the bathroom is perfect. The bed is comfortable and the external areas have a nice view. The free tea and cocktail served every day at the lounge is a great idea. Congratulations.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located and good value”
Reviews.Author: jdshaw001
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were really friendly and helpful. My only criticism is that the "buffet tea" ends far too early for business travellers and the hotel should consider extending the hours until at least 2130. Room was well appointed, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: karenmab
Reviews.Content: this was my first trip to Europe and I was not disappointed. The staff was friendly and helpful. Upon arrival we had included transportation. The cab driver overcharged us, we did not realize it at the time the tip was included. The staff actually got some of our money back from the driver. The location was fabulous and close to everything. The room was very nice and the bathroom was huge! I have recommended this hotel to others who have also shared they loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location & fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: kcarruthers
Reviews.Content: I arrived in pouring winter rain a day early for my booking and the staff made me welcome immediately. My room was newly renovated, very large and comfortable (especially by Parisian standards). The room had a decent sized bathroom with a full bath/shower. The hotel does a lovely breakfast (that was included in my room rate) and serves tea in the lobby in the evening. Throughout my stay the staff were most attentive and helpful. The location of the hotel is great - 5 mins walk to metro George V and Champs-Élysées, not far from shops and easy access to museums and opera. This hotel offered me great value for money and I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BLANBLAN45
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel either for business or for personal trip People are very welcome, rooms have been refreshed, and are very nice. Location is also great, nice district of Paris and close to metro (Ligne n°1) Quality/price ratio is globally very good.

Reviews.Title: “The location, the friendly service, the value can't be beat.”
Reviews.Author: ArchieRice
Reviews.Content: I've stayed many places in Paris for work, but this is a favourite. A great value and location. And Denis, their concierge, is among the most helpful and personable I've met.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Pollilop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location, just a short walk to Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysses. We were kindly upgraded to a large twin room with a view of The Eiffel Tower! Friendly and helpful staff. Slightly disappointed that the bar wasn't open at 10pm on Friday night, it would have been nice to have a nightcap to round off the day (mini bar in room only had a tiny selection of soft drinks, however these were free). All in all a lovely hotel and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Panda2010_10
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris! Friendly staff that was willing to help book tours, send postcards home, and answer any questions. The location was perfect for walking around and seeing everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: haithamchick
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my Fiance in this Hotel at end of October 2010. i am a frequent vistor to paris and i can say very easily it was one of the best. we were very satisfied with all aspects during our stay: from first moment of our arrival we were received with warm welcome and smiling faces. Our room was spacious,clean, renovated and well furnished. Breakfast was very good, and the afternnon tea time was a innovative good idea. Last but not least i wish to thank the freindly staff specially Mr. Denis, who was very kind and helpful at all time. We strongly recomend this hotel for leisure and business.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: 1countryboy
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris for the first time September 28th to October 4th. This hotel was perfect. The location was a short walk to the Champs Elysees, and the Arc of Triumph. The Hotel staff is multilingual, which is a huge plus when one does not speak the language well. The Hotel was clean, my room was larger than I expected. Free breakfact buffet and evening tea buffet was a pleasant suprise. One piece of my luggage was lost on arrival in Paris, I filled out the paper work at the airport and proceded to the hotel. When I told the hotel manager what had happened, he copied the lost luggage claim form and over the next two days made the phone calls to track my luggage and delivered it to my room. Cyril, thank you so much. Denis the bellman was a great asset with suggestions of things to do and directions on getting there. I will definitely stay at this hotel again when I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service. Great location. Proficient staff”
Reviews.Author: amatz48
Reviews.Content: We stay at the hotel for 6 days. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The rooms were big and very clean. The breakfast is very good and the Tea at 5 o'clock is really an asset. We recomment this hotel and will go back soon

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mel090909
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel for 4 nights for our anniversary. Hotel room was one of the upgraded rooms, which was big by Paris standards. Breakfast and evening buffet was nice and filling. Would agree with comments previously about an iron - we were actually told to buy one!! Which we did, though finally after a few phone calls to different members of staff they did manage to locate (burnt) one within the hotel. Would stay here again due to the location and saving 50% by booking through lastminute secret hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonerful Place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: cat_000_lrt
Reviews.Content: I just spent 2 lovely nights at this hotel. The staff was always pleasant and extremely helpful. My room was upgraded and the French champagne was a nice extra touch. It’s in a great location and offers a lovely breakfast, and early evening snacks. When I go back to Paris I plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “In one sentence..this hotel is grubby, very dated and massively overpriced, even by Paris standards"”
Reviews.Author: f10cry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Paris in Sep 2010 for our 10yr wedding anniversary. I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor. I booked an executive double room at a price of 290 euros for 1 night. This is apparently a four star hotel. Well....let's just clear that up. If this is a four star hotel then I am in line for a Noble Laureate. We checked in at 2pm at a desk which hasn't seen a lick of paint in 20 years and had a door open to a small room with some rubbish in it. We were shown to our "executive room" on the 5th floor, via a lobby with dated, grubby furniture and pieces of food on the floor...into a lift which could barely take 2 people (forget about baggage). Our room (which may have looked stylish circa 1971) had plaster and paint flaking off one area of the wall and ceiling and a bathroom which, although clean, would barely have had room for both of us. In fairness to the staff, when I complained (which I really don't like doing unless VERY disappointed), they transferred us to a nicer suite on the 7th floor which had a decent view out to Montmartre and the Sacre Couer. Having spent the afternoon in the city we arrived back to the hotel in the early evening to get ready for a meal out and requested an iron as some of my wife's clothes had got crumpled during travel..we were told that the hotel did not have an iron but we could walk 5 minutes to a shop which would press her clothes!! (directions provided)...The kind of 4 start service this hotel is no doubt renowned for....The food was still on the lobby floor 5 hours after check in... If you are on a budget and can get a cheap deal in this hotel then maybe it's ok...the location is fine..but to pay 300 euros for this place is a joke to be honest..I travel a lot and it was dire and completely overpriced even by Paris standards..4 star hotels don't have crummy buffets in the lobby in the evening, and they do have a decent bar (with staff) where you can have a drink and relax...(this doesn't) A bitterly disappointing experience considering it was a wedding anniversary trip...AVOID at all costs..there are much better hotels in the city..the fabled concierge "Denis" was nowhere to be seen by the way...

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located”
Reviews.Author: Hellboundtrain
Reviews.Content: Booking done online. Hotel was spot on and got our room ready earlier than advertised check-in time. Very friendly Concierge and staff. The rooms are clean tidy, the beds comfortable. The special on offer when we stayed included breakfast, some soft drinks in the mini-bar in the room (1st day only) and afternoon tea from 5:30 to 8:30 - a pretty lavish feast. The hotel is a couple of blocks from the Ar de Triomf, a block from the Champs Elysee and close to several Metro stations - perfect for getting anywhere in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: judymcb
Reviews.Content: The daytime concierge, Dennis, was the best. He was friendly, funny, knows everything about Paris, and was a great help getting us around the city. Rest of day/night staff great also.

Reviews.Title: “good!”
Reviews.Author: sreeIndia
Reviews.Content: The only drawback was continental breakfast!!!! no eggs or meat ---- this was made up by excellent tea time buffet. Location and housekeeping also o.k.

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: OldCourse
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a great 3 night weekend in Paris, largely due to our stay at the Hotel Etoile St Honore. We took our daughter for a mini break before she starts college. The hotel location is fantastic, a mere 5 minutes from the Arc de Triomphe/Etoile CDG Metro stop and a similar distance from Ternes Metro, which we used to and from Gare Du Nord on arrival and departure. The immediate area is quiet and all but closed in the evenings but, being so close to bustle of Champs Elysee, its nice to return to calm of the hotel after a night out. We had 2 similar rooms on the 1st floor. Fair sized rooms compared to our last Parisian shoebox. The bed was firm and comfortable. The aircon worked perfectly, ideal as oustide temps were 30C. Bathroom was nice and clean with a reasonably powerful over-bath shower. Free soft drinks in the fridge was a nice touch, but given the heat, an extra bottle of water wouldn't have gone amiss, especially as we checked out before breakfast on our last morning! The included buffet breakfast was very good, scrambled eggs, ham and sausage, the ubiquitous pastries and croissants as well as cereal and yoghurts, good coffee and a good selection of teas. We enjoyed the generous late afternoon free snack buffet, another nice touch. Tea/coffee, water and fruit juices are made available for you on a self service basis. Bread rolls, ham, cheese, a couple of terrines and some nice cake are available to eat and it was a nice treat to round of a day of sightseeing, before getting ready to go out for the evening. For value, location, comfort and the extras you can do a lot worse in Paris than a stay at the Etoile St Honore.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBoundOttawa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel previously for a business trip and purposely booked it for a family vacation with my husband and 15 year old son. The hotel is located about a 6 minute walk from the Champs d'Elysees. We were given a very large room room with two bathrooms and a sleeping area for my son. The hotel also offers other perks - full buffet breakfast is included; welcome glass of champagne per person and several soft drinks and water for free in your mini fridge. The staff were excellent - particulary Denis - and couldn't do enough to ensure our satisfaction. I highly recommend this hotel - excellent value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “the best place to stay near the Champs Elysees”
Reviews.Author: silvio23
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with my wife and kids. This hotel is very clean, the rooms had been renovated and the room are very large. We are surprised to discover a bottle of champagne in our room on arrival. Staff very kind. We will come back there for sure for our next trip in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel near Arc de Triomph - very comfortable and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Lisatk
Reviews.Content: The Etoile Saint Honore is in a quiet neighborhood near the Arc. The hotel staff is very attentive and helpful - especially the concierge, Denis, who speaks fabulous English and is constantly straightening up the lobby and helping the guests. Our room was a suite with two bedrooms and two bathrooms: perfect for a couple with a teenage son. My husband and I enjoyed drinking coffee in the lobby in the morning while reading the newspapers in several languages. There is a wonderful breakfast as well with great pastries, sausages, eggs, fruit, etc. We had a lovely four night visit.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T LET YOURSELF BE FOOLED BY THE FOUR STARS”
Reviews.Author: margaritalabailarina
Reviews.Content: Lousy experience when you think you have really booked a four star hotel and it hardly reaches a 2 star category! I booked two rooms: one was large and comfortable but the other one was very small and in bad shape. The grout in the bathrooms' tiles were dirty and with mildew! No soap the showers. Safe in one of the rooms was anything but safe (lock could be removed). Free mini bar had only 1 bottle of diet coke,1 regular coke, 1 bottle of still water,1 bottle of sparkling water and 1 can juice (For 2 guests per room). They never replaced it without asking for it at front desk (replacement they had said was on first and thrid day). Very poor breakfast and poor service! Every day the same food. Not for healthy food eaters! And don't expect to have eggs cooked to order. Wet scrambled eggs! Beware of free wi-fi and do not forget to leave your laptop locked in your suitcase! Unathorized people mess with your laptop. Also beware of desk top computer available in lounge area: default was set up to remember accounts, passwords, cookies etc.. Extremely small elevators (for 2 people only without luggage). AC deficient in common areas, however good in rooms. The only good thing to talk about was location (about seven blocks from Arc de Triomphe)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: mollyd138
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in July 2010. We had booked another hotel in Paris, but they didn't have a room for us and wanted to put us up in an apartment down the street. We went online quickly to find somewhere we could stay the very next day, and Best Western Etoile Saint Honore popped up. When we got there the next day, we could not have been happier. Our room was big, which we were surprised to find in Paris. Everything in the room was clean, and well maintained. We were there during a heat wave, and the air conditioning was great after walking around Paris all day. The staff at the front desk could not have been nicer. They helped us book a boat cruise, and a trip to Versailles, and helped us with dinner suggestions. My husband and I don't mind walking, and this hotel was about 10 minutes from the Champs Elysees. There are metro stops close by as well. I would absolutely stay here again, and recommend it to anyone going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great location, lovely room, profesional staff”
Reviews.Author: kaza100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Etoile Saint Honore for one night during a business trip to Paris with clients diner at Night. The location is absolutely fabulous with a very reasonable price for Paris. Ask for a room on the 7th floor, they are spacious newly refurbished in design style with a balcony and a great view over Paris. The price including the welcome buffet and drinks is a very nice touch and make the hotel very welcoming. The staff has been very helpful and profesional. I would definitely come back to the Etoile St Honore for my next trip to Paris. Carine, England

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable would go again”
Reviews.Author: russell38
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel good and clean facilities. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would certainly recommend this Hotel to anyone going to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel with lots of extras.”
Reviews.Author: markdroitwich
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on 23 June 2010. Having read a few of the reviews on here, was a bit sceptical, and after booking as a "Top Secret Hotel " on last minute dot com, expected the worst. However, my standard / classic room was very spacious for Paris, massive bathroom with separate shower and wc, very good location, with two metro stations less than ten mins walk away, and minutes away from Arc de Triomphe. Afternoon buffet, free soft drinks in minibar, and free welcome drink all welcome extras, especially as you can easily pay 2.5 euros for a bottle of water in Paris these days. Not a four star deluxe, but all in all not a bad little hotel.... would probably stay here again if in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the research”
Reviews.Author: JulesTravs
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we purchased our air tickets before we realized we would be there at the beginning of the French Open. We tried and tried to priceline a hotel for a reasonable price - just was not happening. However, we were fortunate to find this wonderful hotel! We booked an Executive room and it was spacious, clean, absolutely perfect. The bathroom was roomy, shower was great. Breakfast is included - a nice plus - didn't care for the coffee but oh well. All of the desk staff was extremely helpful - especially Denis "the meance"!

Reviews.Title: “large room and bathroom, good service, a bit far from tube”
Reviews.Author: solot190356
Reviews.Content: Plus points : The room was unusually large as well as the bathroom. Staff was very nice. Breakfast and free of charge tea (for me it was dinner) were good and it saved me the expense and the need of going out for dinner since tea lasted till 20.30. Minus points : the tube station mentioned next to the adress is Charles de Gaulle Etoile. Far too far. I used repeatedly Saint Philippe du Roule which is closer but with only one line servicing it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dusya0982
Reviews.Content: The photos on the site do not represent reality. We booked 2 rooms in February with the arrival date end of May. When we arrived at the hotel, we were told, there are no rooms next to each other since the hotel is fully booked, so we got 1 room in the 2nd and other in the 5th floor. Nobody has asked if we want a smoking or non-smoking room, so one of the rooms offered was really old and dirty and full of smoke after the previous guests. Only after we complained we were able to get a normal room. Breakfast was ok, however each day smth was missing either knifes of glasses. Location of the hotel is close to the city center. The renovated rooms are ok, however in the showers there are no curtans, therefore the water is running out on the floor. Also the shower itself is really small and rather for a small person.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic, perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Simonc12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, perfect location, staff very friendly, rooms very clean (bed very comfy), very nice touches (glass of champagne, buffet breakfast & tea) Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Turlinator
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, the location was very easy for us (although be careful you don't confuse it with the other 2 Best Westerns on the same street!), the room was clean and airy and the bed comfortable. Overall, we were very happy with our stay and would recommend it. Although the package we got included breakfast, evening buffet and a welcome champagne we only availed of the champagne which was a bit of fun!

Reviews.Title: “By far not 4****”
Reviews.Author: Inspecting9
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that falls short by far to the category it claims to have. It is barely a 3***. Hotel is old, rooms feel old and not renovated. Hotel wants to save money in all aspects: If you want a soap, you need to call for it. If you want a robe, you need to ask for it. Our room was noisy and looking over a roof... It was supposed to be superior, but we were not happy. I was supposed to get a good price, about EUR 160 per night, beleive me, you can get MUCH better for that price... DON'T GO

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel, service could be better”
Reviews.Author: tattitalk
Reviews.Content: In terms of what you get for the 'all in one' concept, read sky_sparkle's review, it is a very accurate description of what you are going to get. I would summarise the offering by saying that it is adequate but not amazing in all aspects except the 'dinner buffet' which is a bit small to make an actual meal and is better described as an evening snack menu. Internet is slow. Room service is a limited menu which is only available Monday through Friday. The room service food probably comes from a nearby italian restaurant, because there is no 'restaurant' in this hotel (only a lounge and a breakfast room). Our room was clean, quiet and good sized. Perfectly adequate. The provided an infant cot as requested. Bed is VERY firm. Our main issue was with the hotel service. The staff were incredibly polite, BUT there were a few issues that were disappointing. When we arrived it was changeover on the front desk and we were asked to sit and wait for 10 minutes. After waiting about that long, we were told our room wouldn't be ready for at least an hour. It was about midday so not its not too surprising that the room wasn't ready yet, but a bit frustrating to wait to be greeted, only to be told that the room was not ready. I expect to be greeted straight away, and we would have left the bags and gone straight out to lunch, no waiting around. When our room was finally ready, we were told our bags would be sent up within 5 minutes. After waiting half an hour, we called downstairs and were told we would need to wait another half hour to get them. So finally, we went and got the bags ourselves. Its worth pointing out here that he elevators are small, so small that our infant pushchair had to be collapsed to get it inside. Seriously, it is about the size of a phone box. On the third day of our stay our room was never serviced/cleaned. When we said something at the front desk, the response was polite enough. By the time we got upstairs there were fresh towels in the room but the dirty ones were not removed. A bag of dirty linens was left in the hallway all night, on another night an iron/ironing board were in the hall. In spite of this, the overall standard of cleanliness in the room was adequate. I wouldn't stay here again, and wouldn't recommend it to others, but its possible that your stay would be just fine.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL AND SITUATION”
Reviews.Author: Maler28144
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was perfect ! We have the chance to meet the management during our check in and they offered us an upgrade into a renovated room (beautiful modern design). The staff was very helpful with our problem of luggage lost in Charles de Gaulle Airport. The location is also very good, 5 min walking to the Champs Elysees avenue. We will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “First class staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smithy24Essex
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel made our party (32) very welcome, nothing was to much trouble for anyone. The rooms where very good, all food provided for us was excellent and the location is excellent for getting around Paris, I have stayed in PAris on many occasions and this hotel is at the top of the list. Thank you one and all.

Reviews.Title: “Great time - great hotel, great staff, another great stay”
Reviews.Author: thisisdidi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from yet another great break in Paris. The hotel could not be faulted. It's location is excellent - close enough to the Champs Elysee but also surrounded by lovely areas such as Ave. Hoche and Ternes where you will find a supermarket and various brasseries, tabacs etc. We ended our trip with a late lunch at The Indian (beside Ternes station). The food was excellent, as was the service. The breakfast provided by the hotel was extremely adequate as was the tea time buffet. It was great that the evening buffet took place from 5.30-8.30pm so there was no fuss around it. We had our voucher for the champagne but found that we didn't have time to use it! Maybe next time! There is a bus (No.43 or 45) that stops on the street of the hotel (take a right and walk up til you see the stop, across the road) - that takes you to Gare du Nord. Takes about 40mins and cost 1Euro70. I would like to write so much more but will leave it at that for now!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very good value...”
Reviews.Author: jackwang1970
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for 4 overnights. I was very impress by the quality of the staff. I have really appreciate the excellent value like the Internet for free of charge, the minibar and the breakfast also... The hotel is locate close to the Champs Elysee avenue. So it was excellent for make shopping after work. I expect to stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: dada_brasil
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from Paris, really liked the hotel, not a 4 star though. First we got a room that was smelling really bad (cigarette) then we got another room and it was really nice. Staff was okay except for the receptionist at night (a man) he's not willing to help at all. The others are nice! Breakfast was nice and Tea Buffet was really good, nice location, very close to the Arc and to go to Trocadero get the bus right on the main street line 22 it's only 6 stops and 1.70 euro :) Would go back there definitely. Oh, wi-fi is very slow and the computer with free access to the Internet is always busy.. And parking is free on weekends (on the street)

Reviews.Title: “excellent location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nm007dubai
Reviews.Content: we travelled to paris from venice and this hotel turned out the best of the tour.There were mixed reviews on the site but what impressed me was the senior management responding to the concerns expressed on this site. i can surely say that the same concern has helped to make this hotel a better place. plus points- great location- near to the famous champ de elysee and arch de triumph. convinient to get on city tours and hop on hop off buses. staff- very friendly. cyril and noramin at the reception very very helpful and dennis(the menace) very energetic and ready to help. all in one concept was great. room charges included breakfast. free internet, evening snacks and a glass of chaampagne was a pleasant surprise. we had a very good time and enjoyed every minute of our stay. minus points- rooms need renovation. doors do needed to be banged to shut them. we got disturbed several times at night because of this.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: JamesMT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 days in this hotel. We were given a spacious room, comfortable, well decorated and furnished. The bathroom was perfectly clean and recently renovated. The staff was very helpful and nice. The location was great, 2 or 3 blocks from the Champs Elysees or metro stop. Breakfast + Mini bar (non alcool beverage) + welcome drink and tea Time diner was included. We will go back in this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Location good, rooms average, service at breakfast poor.”
Reviews.Author: mariner78
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were pleasant but service at breakfast was very poor due to the lack of staff. The buffet breakfast was fine but you had to clear your own table then look for clean plates and cutlery and wait while the food trays were restocked. Hint to hotel - buy more plates and cutlery and employ a couple more staff for breakfast - it's that simple..

Reviews.Title: “absolute nightmare”
Reviews.Author: TraveldaftScotland
Reviews.Content: Do not touch this hotel with a barge pole!!! Yes it is fairly cheap and the tea time buffet is included BUT the buffet is the left overs from breakfast and the breakfast still has the leftovers from the buffet. The waiting staff are very unfriendly and give the impression you are inconveniencing them. The visitors book was taken away as it was full of complaints, no hot water, sockets not working, complaints about the food. Stay here at your peril...

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel for location, comfort and service.”
Reviews.Author: renEllicottCity_Md
Reviews.Content: While the hotel did not have the usual American ammenities such as a pool, spa, restaurant and fitness center, it was a terrific value. The room was very clean and comfortable, the location was near to 2 metro stations, the complimentary breakfast was more than adequate (thanks to the American coffee!) and the complimentary evening "tea" was a nice treat. The staff was courteous and helpful in all matters and spoke English. Denis was outstanding in making us feel comfortable and helping us get around.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: rtkap
Reviews.Content: The hotel is has a great location close to Champs Elleysee but the staffing is minimal for a four star hotel and staff members are visibly over stretched. For example there is only ONE person on duty over night, there is no room service and only two people serve the entire breakfast hall!! Recommend the Deluxe or Executive rooms which are spacious.

Reviews.Title: “try not to stay in the cheap rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravCdeWurld
Reviews.Content: I had a good deal, but saw on the website they have renovated and not renovated rooms. So I booked a superior room, was quite surprised when the room was old and ugly when I arrived. A junior colleague got a much better room (what we had booked), so the next day I was changed to a new room. They didn't apologize for the mistake though. It was quite noisy through the walls. Heard the people 3 doors away play loud music. The new room was lovely and clean. Roomservice was nothing special. The bill at the end is wrong. They show PD (petit dejeuner) for every day of the stay, so even the day you arrive after 2pm. So for 4 nights, I was charged for 5 breakfasts, although I only had 3. Minibar was incorrect too. They charged for things I 'd never seen in the fridge. They forgot the wine though, so I mentioned this. Last time I tried to book the same kind of deal, the price had doubled. I definitely don't want to pay more than 200 for this hotel, the breakfast is quite meager too, not worth 20 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: fussylady
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in the hotel having stayed here previously. I was dreading it as had not enjoyed it two years earlier but had no choice as to where to stay. The superior room we had was a great improvement on the old fashioned room we had before as it was very stylish especially the black and white bathroom. I was very surprised that there was no soap as such in the bathroom, only in holders and if you are having a bath are not easily accessible. No other toiletries were provided either apart from tissues and I cannot remember having stayed in a hotel that did not provide that for years and I have stayed in some really basic places when travelling around . The worse thing about the htoel was the service. We were meeting people from another country and were told that they had already arrived . In the afternoon we asked to be put through to their room and were told they had not arrived yet! The first information was correct. The service at breakfast was non-existent. Plates were not cleared from tables even when tables were needed. No extra plates on the buffet table. The fruit salad had tough pieces of pineapple in it. You even had to write out your own docket for breakfast and when you did not do it immediately they were quite rude. The restaurant needs redecorating as well. In the evening we wanted to have a drink when we returned which was before 11 p.m. and were told that they were not serving anymore! The mini bar was not refilled with soft drinks so there was one apple juice, one orange juice, one still water, one fizzy water and a coke for two people! They did give you a free welcome drink which included a glass of champagne if you wanted it which was good and there was a free tea from 5.30 which was completely unnecessary. Some of our friends were in rooms that have not been renovated and they were pretty dire. This hotel needs far more staff to come anywhere near a 4 star hotel it is probably a 3 star at best. It was 199 Eur a night and to be honest was probably worth 150 max. They apparently have room service but not at weekends! I hate to think how long it would take. The location is not bad near the Arc d'Triomphe and you can easily get a metro or a bus to the main places.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Yoroshiku
Reviews.Content: I spend 2 nights in this hotel. Staff was very helpful. The hotel was busy but understaff. Breakfast + Mini bar (non alcool beverage) + welcome drink and tea Time diner was included. Very good price value. Impossible to have a late check-out even you are a Best Western Member.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel closed to the Champs Elysees”
Reviews.Author: HotelBlogs
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in this hotel on a Saturday while we were enjoying a weekend breakaway in Paris. We were given a deluxe room on the top floor where we could see the Eiffel Tower. The room was modern with nice décor with a grey theme. The bathroom was very nice and seems it has been renovated recently. We also have a widescreen TV on the wall facing our twin beds. The lobby is very welcoming with nice receptionists. We had a coffee in the lounge with our friends which was quiet and cosy. They have a grand piano as well there (can't play on it though). The hotel is located minutes away from the Champs Elysées and you can find some nice restaurants when you go towards Place de Ternes. A good 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: kassie73
Reviews.Content: We booked a family suite. It had 2 connecting rooms and 2 bathrooms. It was much more space than we needed but very welcome when you have 2 little kids. The hotel was clean and functional. Not luxurious but we did not expect that at the price we paid. The location is fantastic. Quiet street but very close to Arc de Triomphe. The staff was friendly and spoke English. we had no view and some construction noise from the top floors in the morning but it was not really intrusive. Overall we had a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: lisagbaby
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious for european standards, the location was great---only a 5 minute walk from the champs elysees and about a 7 minute walk to the closest metro stop----st. phillipe de roule The complimentary breakfast we had was nice, mainly croissants/nutella/fruit room service was nice although they dont have soap/shampoo just a "hair and body gel" that didn't clean anything so bring your own travel size ones!! the tv only has one english channel---cnn our stay was great EXCEPT!! the very first night we spent in paris, we stayed out til about 130 am and when we returned to the hotel, the doors were locked and there was nobody at the front desk, we buzzed and buzzed and knocked and nobody came (there is another best western across the street and we went there and had them call our hotel---to no evail) finally....after 35 mintues of panicking that we were locked out someone came and unlocked the door saying that at night they have to lock it if they are doing work in the back thankfully, that didn't happen the other nights. overall, it was a nice location and a very safe one.
