Reviews.Title: “mediocre hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: surferchik
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel, first and foremost, is the location. I guess that is the only reason they can get away with charging what they do, as its pretty much a two star hotel by north american standards. It's in a very tourist friendly area, about a five minute walk from the Champs Elysee, ten minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe. If you're fit and have good walking shoes, the Eiffel tower is about an hour away. To get there, you pass the Grand and petit Palais, via the gorgeous Pont Alexander III (the famous bridge you see in so many photos of Paris), stroll along the seine and pass the Musee du Quay Branley, which was designed by Jean Nouvel. If you walk straight down to the end of the champs elysee, (30 min to an hour), there are some nice gardens, and beyond that is the Place de la Concorde (famous for the obelisk and being the site of the guillotine during the revolution), the Tuileries garden, and the Louvre. It's great that everything is within walking distance. Lots of great shops and restaurants along the champs elysee as well. The hotel itself was a mixed bag. The front desk was very friendly and everyone spoke impeccable English. They failed to pass on an important message (I arrived on a different flight than my husband. one desk clerk told my husband I hadn't checked into the room, when in fact I had two hours before, and he was quite worried). I think this was because they changed shifts. However, clerks were really helpful with answering all of our questions and were kind enough to store our laptops while we were out sightseeing (there is no safe in the room). There was also the bellhop whose name I forgot, who other reviewers mentioned, I only met him once but was impressed by his friendliness and he had a lot of good tourist tips as well. As others have mentioned, the old elevator is tiny and barely fits two people, or else one large person and their bag. If you weigh more than 350 pounds I'm not sure it would be comfortable. If you get a room by the elvator, you can hear it going at night. Room was small and had a view of a concrete wall! Furnishings were really dated and the bedspread was cheap looking polyester. Room was very clean however. they were very skimpy with the soap and toiletries, and I had to ask for more soap on two different days. This was very strange. Not sure if they are trying to be environmental or just cheap. I had left a reasonable tip on both days and figured the cleaner should have noticed the soap was a tiny sliver. the lobby is nice and there is internet but it's quite expensive. I think it was almost one euro per minute if not more. I was looking for an internet cafe and didn't see in the neighbourhood. The streets around the hotel are a bit confusing, as its an old neighbourhood and the streets are at odd angles to one another. to add further confusion, there are about five best western hotels within a five block radius of this hotel, and just across the street on the same block is another best western! My husband got lost the night he arrived because the outside sign on the side of our hotel was not lit up at night, whereas it was on the other hotels. I would suggest getting a map from the front desk, and being alert to the street names and landmarks on the first day or so. We spent an hour one night trying to find a particular restuarant in the neighbourhood, and by the time we found it, they had stopped serving dinner! this made us laugh. we got directions from a number of locals who tried to be helpful, most of them did not speak english, so it helps to speak some basic french. The neighbourhood is quite safe and there seem to be a lot of good bars, cafes and nightclubs nearby as well. There are lots of people walking around at midnight. Felt much safer than home. My only other complaint would be that there was a paucity of convenience stores in the area. Nor did I see a grocery store. Ended up getting bottled water from Starbucks on Rue de berri (they also serve freshly squeezed orange juice, yum!). There are little stands in the park e.g. le Jardin de champs elysee, that sell fruit, bottled water and crepes, and this is actually a little bit cheaper. Aovid the mini bar.... unless you want to pay 5 euros ($8 canadian) for a small bottle of juice. I might stay here again, but only because of the location. Next time I'd probably do more research and try to find better quality for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “don't recommend”
Reviews.Author: sunakids
Reviews.Content: dirty, so small... expensive breakfast with spoiled orange juice and exactly same menu every day. sketchy street. charging stamp postcard to USA 3 euro and 20euro for electiric adapter... not really kind on front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, Friendly, Great Location, Cute Room too!”
Reviews.Author: Ikeybabe
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific stay at the Best Western Etoile Saint-Honore!! At first when we checked in - despite having requested on the reservation a non-smoking room - we were given a room that had an extremely strong stench of cigarettes. I asked for another room and got the cutest little yellow room. The room was spacious enough - not huge, but not tiny either. Our view from the fourth floor wasn't great at all. No major monuments to speak of. We loved the separate water closet for the toilet and the bathroom of yellow tiles with a separate shower and tub was well-lit and so nice. We did not have breakfast a single morning, but the bakery just down the street had the best pasteries. And this hotel was within walking distance to the Arc de Triomphe and the Metro. We felt safe walking back to the hotel at night and had a problem-free stay. Oh yes, and there was a bell hop named Denis that was terrific. He gave us advice on how to tip at restaurants, cabbies and just some great general conversation. He's a sure asset to the Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “loved this place”
Reviews.Author: momsabeach
Reviews.Content: I know, at first we thought, yuck, a Best Western? In Paris? But this place was great. our room was huge, compared to most European hotel rooms. Lovely bathroom. Soft big bed. wonderful lobby/ sitting area. The staff was very nice, limited English. Very affordable for a couple of average Joe's like us. But as always, Location Location Location! We could walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Champs Elysee, and the upscale shops on Saint Honore.

Reviews.Title: “Big room with view of the Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: sonzyNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in Nov 2007 and had a very enjoyable stay. Unlike all the reviews we had read about paris hotels having small rooms this hotel gave us a fairly good size room with it's own individual balcony from where we could see the Eiffel Tower. Best part was to sit in the room and see the sparkling lights of the Eiffel every hour in the evening. The location is also good - about 7mins walk to Arc de Triuomph and 7mins to Champs Elysees. We even walked to the Eiffel Tower which was about 30mins. Staff at the hotel was quite friendly. Overall the stay of 3 nights was fantastic and if ever we visit Paris again would definately stay here again. Sonia .. Delhi, India

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms; good location”
Reviews.Author: rosscoe7999
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in October 2007 while traveling for business. The location is quite good. It is just 2-3 blocks from the Champs-Elysees and another block or two to the Arc de Triomphe. I arrived on a Sunday afternoon, and I was surprised that literally none of the shops right around the hotel were open. I guess they cater primarily to the businesses nearby, so they are closed on weekends. But, it is only a short walk to the Champs-Elysees, and everything was open there. The rooms in this hotel, especially for Europe, are quite large. They are very well-appointed and comfortable. The water pressure in the shower was good and I had no problem with having enough hot water. I did not eat in the hotel so I cannot comment on the food, although my colleagues seemed to enjoy breakfast well enough. The lifts are microscopic, so if you have more than one large bag, you may have to make two trips. The front desk personnel were very helpful with providing maps and directions as well as securing taxis when needed. All in all, a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Find”
Reviews.Author: Cath0508
Reviews.Content: When we decided to visit Paris we had no idea where to stay. I read numerous reviews of different hotels warning against small rooms and high prices. I have stayed at quite a lot of Best Westerns and have never had to complain so choose this hotel for location and price. The hotel is within walking distance of many tube stations so we very easy to find on arrival. Check-in went very smoothly and took less than a minute so we where happy. We went up to our room and where nicely surprised, it was clean and a reasonable size. When had a television and mini bar (which was stocked!) . We also had a kettle with tea and coffee so we where well catered for. The bathroom was also very clean and looked pretty new, it even had complimentary amenities. Now I am not claiming this is four star as it definetly isn't however for the price and the amount of time we actually spent there it was well worth the money. From the hotel you can walk to the Arc D'Triomphe and also the Champs Elysees quite easily. We even walked to the effiel tower however if your not into walking the tube may be better for this. The hotel automatically adds breakfast to your room bill however will remove it if not taken. We had breakfast out each day so I don't know what it was like however it did seem expensive. One little tip there is a Chinese Restaurant on the Rue D Washington which is not to be missed, they have lots of Koi Carp under the glass floor it is brilliant! One thing also to share is that because we travelled in August a lot of the French restaurants where closed which was a little dissapointing. If you are looking for a clean, reasonable priced hotel in Paris this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Super little hotle”
Reviews.Author: Pitnic
Reviews.Content: This hotel, despite some earlier reviews, really couldn't do enough for us. The front desk (Camellia and Co) were absolutely charming whilst dealing with about 6 requests at once including a non-stop phone. Our room was large, well appointed and the shower excellent. An ironing board and iron were delivered within 4 minutes and taxis were waiting when requested. Yes, the two lifts are small, but how big do you want a lift to be? They work well and the stairs are always an option! Will definitely stay there on all my future Paris visits. Reasonable, delightful and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location...pleasant hotel...very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: westiefan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 3 nights including a weekend at end Nov 2006. We got an excellent web rate of 70 euros per night per room excluding breakfast. We found the hotel easy to find after a short walk from CDG Etoile Metro . Having read some reviews I was pleasantly surprised. My standard room (225) contained a large double bed which was very clean , good storage space , mini bar , kettle and fresh decor. Importantly there was plenty of moving about space, not the notrious sideways shuffle as experienced in some Parisian hotels. Yes the lifts are of the small Parisian type but they work. The Bathroom was of adequate size to swing a hairbrush and had a clean bath fittings with shower . The hairdryer is one of those ghastly wall fitted hot pipe affairs so as recommended take your own. My room overlooked the back of the hotel out onto some unused land and was very quiet which enabled me to leave the double glazed window open. My friends room contained two good sized twin beds and was again of same dimensions. There is a good lounge bar area but because of the hotels location there is access to plenty of eating and drinking places from the hotel. Literally a few doors up from the hotel is a patisserie with a small cafeteria called Do Re Me that serves excellent coffee and pastries which is a lot cheaper than spending 20 euros on breakfast in the hotel.They also have a brasserie nearby . All in all I was very happy with this hotel , the staff were very friendly and helpful and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No problems - very pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Loll
Reviews.Content: BW Etoile Saint Honore. . . .it's a Paris hotel, so you get the typically quirky lifts and windy stairs etc. My room was an average hotel room - clean, functional, not luxurious but perfectly adequate. I was staying on business and it met all my requirements. The bar area is nice for a drink before setting out to select a restaurant for dinner - there are plenty a short walk away. There is no restaurant in the hotel although they do offer a limited room service. Breakfast is OK - expensive for what it is, but if you're not sure when you will be able to grab a meal later in the day it will do the job. It's a nice area - I walked back to the hotel on my own at 1.00am and didn't feel in any way concerned (and I am a woman). Hairdryers are useless - so bring your own, and there is no iron and ironing board as standard in your room - but I'm sure if I have needed one they would have provided this. The staff are what made this hotel stand out - they were so friendly and helpful I almost thought I was in the wrong city! They all speak excellent English, always spoke and asked how things were going and resolved any problems.
